thread.title: Mark Wood in good spirits after a tough day in the field for England
thread.title_full: Mark Wood in good spirits after a tough day in the field for England

title: Mark Wood in good spirits after a tough day in the field for England
text:
Mark Wood in good spirits after a tough day in the field for England 22 Oct 2015 14:31:52 
comments 
Mark Wood and his England team-mates are not 'too disheartened' after day one of the second Test against Misbah-ul-Haq-inspired Pakistan. 
After last week's test ended in a draw, England did all that could be expected to stay in contention after losing the toss in Dubai. 
Wood, Ben Stokes and James Anderson all bowled admirably to limit the damage to 282 for four at stumps, despite Misbah's unbeaten 102, and half-centuries too from fellow veteran Younus Khan (56) and opener Shan Masood (54). 
"All-in-all, I don't think we can be too disheartened," Wood told Sky Sports 1. 
"I think we bowled quite well as a group and we know that they have got a bowler at number eight, so if we can get a couple of wickets out early morning then hopefully we can knock the tail over. 
"We have only got four wickets so I cannot say it has been a brilliant day, but we stuck at it and can hold our heads high." 
England seamer Wood tried to play aggressively at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium, although accepts Misbah edged that duel. 
"A couple of times I tried to rough up Misbah, but he got the better so it is 1-0 to him," he said. 
"It will be interesting to see how Misbah plays because he seemed to have a lot of dot balls against the seamers and attack the spin. 
"It'll be interesting to see how he plays tomorrow if we choose to go for spin early and if he'll try to attack again." Related Sport News
